alert.note: Alert for Kahoolawe in Maui (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 03 at 2:19PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM HST THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE ISLAND OF MAUI IN MAUI COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The island of Maui in Maui County. * WHEN...Until 415 PM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 214 PM HST, radar indicated very heavy rain was nearly stationary over the southwest slopes of Haleakala, with rainfall rates in excess of 2 inches per hour. Rapid water rises are expected in drainage gulches that flow through portions of Kihei and Wailea, including Keokea Gulch, Kihei Gulches 2, 3 and 4, and Liilioholo Gulch. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ulupalakua, Makena, Wailea and Keokea. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 415 PM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Rainfall and runoff will also cause hazardous driving conditions due to ponding, reduced visibility and poor braking action. Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown.
